item.title: Sonic Dream Team ‘Shadow Levels’ update now available
item.content:encoded:
https://www.gematsu.com/2025/03/sonic-dream-team-shadow-levels-update-now-available

  • Smartphone

New stages, new mission, and more.

Publisher SEGA and developer HARDlight have released a free update for action platformer Sonic Dream Team, which adds three new levels playable by Shadow, a new mission, new interactable gameplay toys, and various other improvements.

Get the details below.

  • Three Brand-New Levels
    • Scrambled Shores, Dream Factory and Nightmare Maze each have a new Act playable only as Shadow.
    • Unlock them through the Shadow reward track, then explore these corrupted environments in Adventure!
  • New Mission
    • Nightmares are spreading through the Dreamworld, sprouting strange nodes of corrupted Magination.
    • Traverse these twisted environments, cleaning up outbreaks before exposing the nightmare’s weak points and destroying them for good!
  • New Interactable Gameplay Toys
    • Trampolines and tightrope springs help players bound over chasms and up impassible walls.
    • Phase platforms flicker in and out of reality – lock them into position with Chaos Control.
    • Sequenced jump panels let players blast over vast distances with ease!
  • A Handful of Small Improvements
    • Many players have been asking if they can replay the tutorials, so these have now been moved to their own section in the Act select. Have fun!
    • Fixed an issue that stopped players from listening to certain music tracks during their adventures.
    • New SFX for Perfect Boost and Perfect Jump.

Watch a new trailer below. View a new set of screenshots at the gallery.

item.title: Side-scrolling action platformer Knuckle Jet announced for PC
item.content:encoded:
https://www.gematsu.com/2025/03/side-scrolling-action-platformer-knuckle-jet-announced-for-pc

  • PC

From Teslagrad series developer Rain Games.

Teslagrad series developer Rain Games has announced Knuckle Jet, a side-scrolling action platformer coming to PC via Steam. A release date was not announced, but the game is described as in “early development.”

Here is an overview of the game, via its Steam page:

About

What’s this? An off-the-wall, riveting jetpunk nose-breaking ricochet action platformer, lovingly crafted by the oddballs behind the Teslagrad series?

Key Features

  • Jet-Fueled Knuckle Acrobatics – Scientifically inaccurate flight action that rewards high-speed momentum and precision. Feel free to completely ignore G-force in the name of awesomeness, and keep smashing, crashing and crushing to stay in the flow!
  • Non-Stop Arcade Action – Tons of standalone levels (How many? we don’t know yet, we’re still making them! but there will be plenty!) packed with fresh things to punch, easily navigable through a revolutionary new innovation we call a “map screen”. Utilize the environment, find rewards, and chase perfection!
  • Hoard Equipment for the Challenges Ahead – Collect and upgrade a large array of gear that offers drastic gameplay changes. Ignore all fashion sense and pick item combinations that suit your playstyle, specialize in optimized builds for each challenge, or go for stylish matching gear—it’s all good.
  • A Rogues Gallery of Despicable Villains – From high-rise clockwork cities to soot black forests, each biome in Motorland is under the grip of the scheming business partners of power-hungry industrialist Baron Tychoon. They’ve kidnapped a whole orphanage and put the little ragamuffins to work among the crushing pistons and spinning cogs of their robotic death machines, and it’s up to you to save the kids. Crush this cadre of conniving crooks before facing the ultimate foe!
  • Drop Into Battle Together With a Friend – It is nice to have friends. It’s even better when they can join you in battle! Fight together across the main campaign, or beat the snot out of each other in a friendly game of Knuckleball.

item.title: PlayStation Japan x YOASOBI ‘PLAYERS’ PlayStation 30th anniversary commercial
item.content:encoded:
https://www.gematsu.com/2025/03/playstation-japan-x-yoasobi-players-playstation-30th-anniversary-commercial

  • PS5

New song based on 30 years of PlayStation memories.

Sony Interactive Entertainment Japan Asia has released a special commercial in commemoration of PlayStation‘s 30th anniversary, which it celebrated on December 3, 2024, featuring the new song “PLAYERS” written by Japanese pop duo YOASOBI.

The concept of the commercial, which is the result of the “Project: MEMORY CARD” initiative, is “saving PlayStation memories in music.” The new song was written based on the PlayStation memories sent in to Sony Interactive Entertainment by users, all of which have been collected via a special website. The song itself is available now via various streaming services.

In the commercial, characters Maru (actor Nanase Nishino), Peke (Virtual YouTuber Pekora Usuda), and Ki-3 (game streamer KIYO) are messing around in Maru’s grandfather’s shop when they uncover a mysterious Memory Card. Plugging the Memory Card into an original PlayStation starts their journey along the “Play Has No Limits” railway, where they through game worlds like a roller coaster ride.

Watch the commercial below.

item.title: Death end re;Quest Code Z launches May 13 in the west
item.content:encoded:
https://www.gematsu.com/2025/03/death-end-request-code-z-launches-may-13-in-the-west

  • PS4
  • PS5

Physical edition due out on June 27 in Europe.

Roguelike RPG Death end re;Quest Code Z will launch for PlayStation 5 and PlayStation 4 on May 13 in the west, publisher Idea Factory International announced. While the physical edition will be available on the same date in North America, it will not be available in Europe until June 27.

In addition to the standard edition, a Limited Edition will also be available for $89.99 / £84.99/ €89.99, which includes a 92-page art book, 32-track soundtrack CD, Sayaka mousepad, exclusive trading card, and a collector’s box.

Death end re;Quest Code Z first launcehd for PlayStation 5, PlayStation 4, and Switch on September 19, 2024 in Japan. While the Switch version was originally planned for release in the west, it was canceled for not complying with Nintendo guidelines.

Here is an overview of the game, via Idea Factory International:

What is the Death end re;Quest series?

A thrilling RPG in which a group of young people traverse a world tainted by bugs, death threatening them at every turn as they confront mysteries and danger. It is packed with despair-inducing Death Ends written by Makoto Kedouin, acclaimed writer of Corpse Party.

The first installment of the Death end re;Quest series launched on PlayStation 4 in 2018 (Japan) and 2019 (North America and Europe), and its sequel, Death end re;Quest 2, was released on PlayStation 4 in 2020 (Japan, North America, and Europe).

Story

Step into a tale of parallel universes…

Iris was born in World DE-1, a world that mirrors Earth in the 2000s. With her birth, a series of tragic loops was set in motion, which were gradually unraveled by the efforts of Arata Mizunashi and his team.

With her goodwill restored, Iris created a copy of World DE-1 named World DE-1.5. Here, feuds gave way to friendship, each person a perfect cog in a perfect world. But a new crisis threatens the peace…

A mysterious man has entered the fray, and he leads a group of people who look identical to the world’s former heroes. Our new hero, Sayaka Hiwatari, confronts the rising chaos, where friends and foes seem impossible to distinguish.

And so the battle with another world enters a new phase…

Key Features

  • No Strain No Gain – Delve deep into the deadly dungeons of the Strain Area, filled with randomly-generated monsters, traps, and more. Think carefully about your actions, because when you move, your enemies will get to take their turn as well. Explore every corner of a dungeon to find useful items, and try to make your way further and further down.
  • Blink and You’re Dead – Every move you make may spell certain death in the form of dozens of violent Death Ends. You may even trigger a brutal Double Death End, featuring gruesome art by Kei Nanameda and overseen by the diabolically twisted Makoto Kodouin.
  • You Keep on Walking and You Don’t Look Back – Your biggest challenge awaits at the bottom of each dungeon. Get ready to test your limits as you must fight a powerful boss. Once the boss is defeated, it’s time to save your friend and try to make it out of the Strain Area alive, your new companion in tow.
  • Bring it Around Town! – Between trips to the Strain Area, make sure to take a break at home where you can stock up on invaluable items, head to the Night Owl Cafe to enhance your weapons, or check in on friends around town.
